questions.question: What is the DOI of the study discussing light-induced spin-crossover magnet?
What phenomenon is observed in Fe2[Nb(CN)8]·(4-pyridinealdoxime)8·2H2O upon light irradiation?
What is the role of 473 nm light irradiation in the study of Fe2[Nb(CN)8]·(4-pyridinealdoxime)8·2H2O?
questions.answer: It induces a spin-crossover from FeII LS to FeII HS, leading to spontaneous magnetization.

questions.question: How does the crystal structure of Fe2[Nb(CN)8]·(4-pyridinealdoxime)8·2H2O contribute to its light-induced magnetism?
questions.answer: The tetragonal structure facilitates the strong superexchange interaction between FeII HS and NbIV through CN bridges, enabling magnetic ordering.

questions.question: What is the significance of the observed coercive field of 240 Oe in the light-induced magnetism study?
questions.answer: It indicates the presence of a magnetic hysteresis loop, demonstrating the material's ability to retain magnetization after the removal of an external magnetic field.

questions.question: True or False: The study demonstrates that light irradiation can switch the magnetic properties of Fe2[Nb(CN)8]·(4-pyridinealdoxime)8·2H2O at room temperature.
True or False: The magnetization induced by light irradiation in Fe2[Nb(CN)8]·(4-pyridinealdoxime)8·2H2O is permanent and does not relax over time.
What is the estimated superexchange interaction constant (Jex) between FeII HS and neighbouring NbIV in the study?
What experimental technique was used to confirm the spin-crossover in Fe2[Nb(CN)8]·(4-pyridinealdoxime)8·2H2O?
True or False: The study's findings suggest that the spin-crossover unit can be used as an optical switching moiety to control magnetic properties in future materials.
